utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Mom? Mom! Mom? Are you here?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: C’mon. C’mon mom, answer.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, hello! Shouldn’t you been in school already?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: School doesn’t start for another hour.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, if you were hoping to do the walk of shame in private, you’re out of luck.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, don’t be silly. I just didn’t realize how early it was. I have been a bit distracted this morning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you mean distracted or hypnotized by that giant rock on your finger?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did Chet Palaburn propose?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Alexis? I think it’s about time we start calling him Uncle Chet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh now, wait a minute, wait a minute you two. I am not engaged, all right? Yes, Chet did propose last night and I told him, you know, I needed time to think about it and he insisted I keep the ring while I make up my mind, so…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm… smart man. Diamonds can be very persuasive. I can hear it now whispering ‘keep me… keep me.’

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Unfortunately now that Chet has upped the ante, as they say, I’m going to have to decide whether I’m in or I’m out.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I thought you loved Chet.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I do love him, darling, I really do. I just … well, you know, for me it’s uh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The thrill is gone.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yes. And it’s been gone for quite awhile. Although this little fella did bring it back for about ten minutes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, if he’s not the one then I guess you shouldn’t marry him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s never stopped her before.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And we miss having you here all the time. Don’t we, dad?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS_MARTHA
utterance.content: Dad?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Saved by the bell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, it’s Beckett. Castle!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Did I hear you right? Our victim is Vivien Marchand, the psychic medium?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: You’ve heard of her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, she was very popular in certain Manhattan circles. Matter of fact, she did a reading for me at a society party about eight years ago. It was pretty extraordinary.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Extraordinary?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She got everything right. You know, come to think of it, she told me that a beautiful woman would one day move into my loft and stay with me forever. She neglected to mention it was my mother. How did she die?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Stabbed in the back of a neck with an ice pick and then stuffed into the sofa.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she didn’t see that coming.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When did she die?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: She’s in full rigor – I’d say yesterday afternoon is the approximate time of death.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ve got a maintenance worker said he saw a man leaving the back door of Vivien’s office around two-thirty yesterday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Description?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tall, Caucasian, and tough looking.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Ryan, check Vivien’s calendar, and let’s interview her clients from yesterday. Maybe one of them saw the guy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What I don’t get is, why put her in the couch?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: She was alive when she went in. These scratches on her face indicate that she tried to move. I’m going to get her back to the lab.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: She’s got a notation here for three PM yesterday. It just says ‘TJ’.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And nothing else?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nope. Maybe TJ was a a ghost coming to visit. Mediums are the ones that can see ghosts, right Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. Psychics can tell the future, mediums can tell the future and talk to the dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s like saying psychics are con artists and mediums are con artists and charlatans. I mean in the end they’re all just fakes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You sound pretty certain of yourself.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s because when I started as a cop I wasted a lot of time on clairvoyants calling tip lines with information that never led to anything. I mean, I’m surprised you’re so gullible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not saying I can speak with the dead. I’m just willing to admit there are people in this world who are more sensitive than me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Now that’s not hard to believe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Walked right into that one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Mmmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Marchand, do you know of anyone who wanted to harm your mother?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: She was a very spiritual person. She didn’t have any enemies.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A witness saw a tall, dark haired man leaving here around two-thirty yesterday. Does that sound like anyone your mother knows?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you two talked?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Around one o’clock. She said she had her last client of the day and then she was going to spend the rest of the afternoon in meditation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know the client’s name?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: No. It was a mother and a daughter. The names should be in her book.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, there was a notation in her calendar at three, the initials ‘TJ’. Does that mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: No. I’m sorry I can’t be more helpful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. I remember this case. A guy’s wife goes missing, he seems genuinely distraught, and then the cops find out he had a girlfriend and that his marriage was on the rocks.

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did your mother help on that case?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Yeah, she had a vision of him at this local bar with this pretty blonde named Amber, so she went to the police with the information. That’s when they started looking at him as a suspect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then what happened?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: He went to prison. That case really put my mom on the map.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did your mother continue offering the police help after that?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Yes, all over the country. My mother helped put over a dozen people away in the last ten years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So here’s a list of all the people that Penny Marchand claims her mom helped to convict. Let’s see if any of them are out of jail and still holding a grudge.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it. Vivien’s one o’clock Monday clients are here. They say they got a good look of the dark haired guy that was in her office. Names are Paula and Marina Casillas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Casillas? That’s a good name. Hard to possessive pluralize, though. The Casillases’ car has broken down, so they will be late for the symphony.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The Casillas … Casillases … they’re waiting for you in the lobby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, thanks.

utterance.speaker: MARINA CASILLAS
utterance.content: Usually we’re her last clients on Monday. But when we left, there was a man there waiting for Vivien. She seemed surprised to see him, like he wasn’t expected. Oh, and he seemed upset, I could tell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Could you describe him?

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: He was wearing dark clothes, he had black hair, going gray at the temples, oh, and he had a scar on his face.

utterance.speaker: PAULA CASILLAS
utterance.content: I think she called him Alfred. Or was it Albert?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Well thank you both, you’ve been very helpful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long had you been going to see Vivien?

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: Four months. My husband, Emilio, passed away in April. We both miss him so much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she was helping you get closure?

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: Yes. Even at our first session, Vivien already knew so much about my Emilio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like what?

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: Well, she knew he made vitamins for a living. She knew he loved arroz con pollo. She also knew he was a workaholic –

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: And that he even died at the office. Vivien said she thought daddy had something very important to tell us. She was going to commune with his spirit last night. Now we’ll never know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re not going to believe this. Vivien’s daughter is pretty sure Albert is Albert Moreno.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Albert ‘the Blade’ Moreno?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Former muscle for the Spolano crime family.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Vivien helped put him away?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uh uh. He’s her client. Vivien told Albert that if he invested in a New Jersey real estate deal, true happiness would be his. The deal fell through a month ago. He lost everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ouch. You give a guy like that bad advice and he’ll see to it that you’re sleeping with the fishes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or you get stabbed in the neck with an ice pick. And stuffed in a couch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Woah. Albert Moreno was sure living large for a low level mobster.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I guess mob money goes a little farther when you don’t have to pay taxes on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And yet for Albert, not far enough.

utterance.speaker: LOREEN CARTER
utterance.content: I’m Loreen Carter, from Real Smart Real Estate. This house is a Tuscan jewel. And it’s perfect for a young couple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re here for Mr. Moreno.

utterance.speaker: ALBERT MORENO
utterance.content: Yes, I went to see her. Three months ago Vivien told me I should invest in some real estate deal. She knew I had … quit my day job. I was looking to set myself up for retirement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She told you the investment would bring you true happiness, but instead you lost it all.

utterance.speaker: MORENO
utterance.content: I was … upset. And then she canceled our last appointment and stopped returning my phone calls …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then you decided to pay her a visit yesterday around two o’clock.

utterance.speaker: MORENO
utterance.content: I told her, I’m on my way to meet my broker. I’m selling my home because I can’t pay my mortgage no more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then what happened Mr. Moreno? Did you get angry? Did things get physical?

utterance.speaker: MORENO
utterance.content: No. But I was mad. And when I’m mad, sometimes people get nervous. She begged me to let the universe sort itself

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she say with whom?

utterance.speaker: MORENO
utterance.content: No. By then I was late to meet my broker so I left, about two thirty. And just like that, the universe? It sorted itself out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m … I’m sorry, I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: MORENO
utterance.content: Turns out, my broker’s partner is Loreen here, my high school sweetheart.

utterance.speaker: LOREEN
utterance.content: We broke up in ’82, but we never got over each other.

utterance.speaker: MORENO
utterance.content: The minute I laid eyes on her again, I haven’t left her side. And I’ve never been so happy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So … Vivien was right. Investing in the real estate deal brought you to bankruptcy, which in turn brought you to Loreen and true happiness. Extraordinary.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I think it’s possible that he killed Vivien before the universe righted itself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not about that, about them. Albert and Loreen, star crossed lovers, reunited by fate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You mean, reunited by coincidence?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, let me guess. You don’t believe in fate. Soul mates?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unicorns? Fairies? Double rainbows? Didn’t you ever think your dolls used to get up at night and play with your toys?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm. Let me guess, you were one of those annoying six year olds that stopped believing in Santa Claus because you figured out he couldn’t travel faster than the speed of light.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I was three and we didn’t have a chimney.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How did it go with Moreno?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: My gut says it’s not him, but we still have to look into his alibi.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, so you don’t believe in fate, but your gut has magical properties. That’s cool … Scully.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We got calls out on most of Vivien’s dirty dozen and should hear back tomorrow. Meanwhile we’ve been going through her client files. Trips to the hall of records, internet searches, even got a hold of some autopsy files. Pretty intimate stuff, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You see Castle? Research. That’s how she made people believe that she has a gift. And I bet that she even looked into you eight years ago when she went to that party. And I bet she looked up Paula Casillas as well. That’s how she knew her husband Emilio had a vitamin business.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that also how she knew Albert Moreno would find true love through bankruptcy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She got lucky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Or maybe it’s just that she couldn’t get everything she needed from her abilities alone and needed to do a little extra digging. I have a fantastic imagination, yet I still do a ton of research when I write a book.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Surrounded by skeptics.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s called being a cop, bro.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh great and powerful spirits, tell us, should Gram break up with Chet Palaburn?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ugh, this thing must be broken. Well luckily, I don’t need the spirits to tell me when it’s time to say goodbye. Goodbye, my love.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What if you’re being too hasty? Relationships take work, right?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No no no, love is not about work. Trust me. It’s about passion, it’s about chemistry … romance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s about your heart pounding faster because you can’t wait to see her.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can either of you look back on a relationship that ended because the thrill was gone and admit that maybe you gave up on love too soon?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you’re back with your ex-wife –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, no, she’s right. With Gina, the thrill was long, long gone. Now, it is back with a vengeance. Of course, it brought along its friends, high maintenance and shopaholic.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry, honey. I’m sorry. But it’s just … it’s over. I know it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Any news on the dirty dozen?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, most are still in prison, but we’re thinking this line of investigation might not get us anywhere.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I called around to a couple of lead detectives, just to check out the level of Vivien’s involvement, and they say they’ve never even heard of her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She exaggerated her involvement in these cases in order to build her reputation back up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or maybe, the cops didn’t want to admit they had a psychic actually helping them. I mean, what police detective would willingly acknowledge that a lay person is as talented at solving crimes as she is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vivien Marchand is not a psychic. I bet my badge on it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Don’t throw those dice until you take a look at this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: New York Homicide Division Detective Squad. It’s from Vivien Marchand.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, it arrived this morning. Postmarked Monday, the day she died.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is her letterhead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “To whom it may concern, I feel that my murder is imminent.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “And although I have no idea where or when this even will occur, I have had a vision of my death. In the vision I could not breathe. I saw a man dressed in black, the numbers 7 5 1 8, and I could hear a furious pounding from what seemed to be far away. I’m sorry I cannot be more specific – “

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Psychic predicted her own murder!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or the killer wrote this in order to throw us off. Run it. Maybe we’ll get lucky with the prints.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you think she really –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, me neither.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie, what do we got?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We’ve got cause of death. Blood loss and asphyxiation and I’m officially putting time of death between five and seven PM on Monday evening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So that rules out Albert Moreno. What else?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: There were no scratches on the ice pick blade. It was brand new, probably bought special just for the occasion. And, her cell phone was in her hand. She may have tried to dial for help before she expired. The digits match the beginning of her daughter’s phone number - 1-718-55 –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 7 1 8 5? Those are the numbers from the letter. They’re in a different order, but those are the same numbers.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, go on. Say it. Say coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m just saying, it’s irrefutable, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not irrefutable, Castle. As a matter of fact, it is completely refutable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, go on. Refute me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, how about this. Vivien is dialing her daughter’s number, our killer comes in, stabs her in the neck, picks up her phone, drops it into the sofa after her, and then puts the numbers into the letter along with the rest of the fake predictions. Refuted!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one types a number into a cell phone anymore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Preliminaries on the letter aren’t giving us very much. There are no usable prints and no DNA. And the pickup at the mail drop in Vivien’s building is six PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time enough for the killer to have written it and mailed it after she was dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But why? Why go through all that trouble?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To keep us spinning wild theories and chasing after men dressed in black instead of following hard evidence. I mean, c’mon, Castle. The letter’s not even signed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Actually, I talked to Penny Marchand about that. She says it’s possible that her mother would type a letter and not sign it in case a prediction was wrong. She wouldn’t want anybody selling her mistakes on the internet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we still can’t prove that Vivien actually wrote the letter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until her other predictions come true.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just gonna –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Good, you’re back. I think I’ve got something. Remember Vivien’s first big case?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, the guy with the missing wife and the blonde girlfriend named Amber.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His name is Steve Adams. Unis are bringing him over right now. They never found his wife’s body. He did seven years for second degree. They released him two months ago on parole, only after he agreed to wear an anklet with a tracking device. So, I called his PO and he sent over this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The GPS readout puts Steve at Vivien’s address Monday afternoon. So Vivien finishes with Paula and Marina Casillas at two, Albert Moreno exits out the back door at two thirty, and now it’s time for her three PM with “TJ”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Steve Adams was there from 1:36 to 2:48. Waiting for his opportunity?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So he waits there until she’s alone, jumps her, stabs her, and then stuffs her in the couch.

utterance.speaker: STEVE ADAMS
utterance.content: This is harassment! I haven’t done anything wrong!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … he’s wearing all black.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s gotta be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or black is the new guilty.

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: I didn’t kill her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You were the last one to see her alive. The GPS on your anklet indicates that you were at her office for over an hour on the day she was killed.

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s not what you think. Last week I got a call from a guy named Cody Donnelly. He’s a reality TV producer. He said he could help me clear my name.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How was he going to do that?

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: The day after my wife disappeared, Vivien Marchand told the cops she had a vision of me in a bar with my girlfriend Amber.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which was true.

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: That I was there? Yeah. But then she started saying that she had other visions, visions that I had murdered my wife, which I did not do. But she was right once, about Amber, so everyone believed her. Only Vivien had lied about that, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: Cody Donnelly told me that he had proof that Vivien was a customer in the same bar where I took Amber that day. So she saw me, all right, with her own eyes. There was nothing psychic about it. Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you figured that if you could prove that Vivien was a fraud that maybe people would believe that you hadn’t killed your wife as well?

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: I’m an innocent man. But thanks to Vivien, everyone in the state believed that I killed my wife. She got a book deal. I got seven to ten.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was in it for Cody Donnelly?

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: He wanted me and Vivien to be in his reality show You’ve Ruined My Life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I love that show! It’s where people unleash their righteous fury against those who’ve wronged them. Usually ends in tears and a hug.

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: Cody and me, we went to her office with a camera crew. We sat outside in the van for almost an hour. When she finally came out, I confronted her. I called her a fake. Cody told me to make it big, so I did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did Vivien do?

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: Mostly she freaked. Then she got into a cab and took off. Cody dropped me off at my apartment on Second and Forty-Fifth and I never saw her again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: GPS puts Adams at his apartment at the time Vivien was murdered. Find me some witnesses that can verify that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t trust the GPS?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, those things can be tampered with. So, Vivien told her daughter that she was going to be at the office all afternoon and then at two forty-five she takes a cab and leaves. To see TJ, whoever that is. Let’s get a hold of Steve Adam’s producer, Cody Donnelly. I want to see him and his footage of Vivien first thing in the morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am so glad that you are home. You would not believe the day I had.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, I think I got you beat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, what’s wrong? And why are you still engaged to Uncle Chet?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, Richard. Chet is dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? How?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I went to his apartment this morning and his kids are there - Boomer and Lottie. They said he’d had a stroke in his sleep. I mean, God I – he was so young and –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So Boomer and Lottie see the ring and naturally they assume that their father and I engaged and now they’re worried about how I’ll handle the news and … and uh, I spent the whole day with them, receiving visitors and … and they kept telling me how happy their father had been since we’d been together and how I was … … the love of his life.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And there I was, about to break his heart. Oh, and now they want me to give the eulogy.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I don’t think I can. Oh, Richard …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m sorry. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: ADAMS
utterance.content: Vivien Marchand? You remember me? You told the cops you had a vision of me in a bar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that the footage from Cody Donnelly?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. He’s waiting for you in interrogation. Where’s Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, he had some personal issues he had to deal with. What do we got?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So far it’s going just as Steve Adams says. Vivien comes out, gets in her face …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She gets in a cab.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And we got a partial on the license plate. I’ll run it down, see if I can find out where the taxi dropped her off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Turn it off, turn it off.

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Detective Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, Penny. What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Is there somewhere that we could talk privately?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong, did you remember something?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: No, it’s not that. I’m afraid I wasn’t completely honest with you the other day. The fact is, I have a little bit of what my mother did. Sometimes I have dreams that are meaningful. Last night, I had a dream about you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: And I can’t really explain why, but I feel very strongly that I’m supposed to tell you something. Something important. Are you ready?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m ready?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Alexander.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Alexand -?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Alexander. I don’t know who he is or what he means to you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know any Alexander.

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: You will. You will meet an Alexander and he will be extremely important to you. At some future date, he may save your life.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, um … good to know.

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Thank you, detective.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you, Penny.

utterance.speaker: CODY DONNELLY
utterance.content: Candid reality gold, mate. Cody Donnelly presents, famous mystery writer follows a tough but beautiful New York cop around “for research”.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, she’d never go for it. She’s a real bi-

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Donnelly, I appreciate you coming… What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh… For the record, I was going to say ‘big rule follower’. I was not discussing the case, swear to God. Uh, Naked Heat comes out tomorrow and Cody here was admiring the billboards.

utterance.speaker: DONNELLY
utterance.content: Is that your smoking hot silhouette on the posters there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. So, Mr. Donnelly, where did you go after you left Vivien’s office?

utterance.speaker: DONNELLY
utterance.content: After we got all that great footage, I dropped Steve off at his place around, uh, three thirty or so? It was just before Vivien Marchand called me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? And what did she want?

utterance.speaker: DONNELLY
utterance.content: To save what was left of her career. I mean, she knew the film I had on her was damaging. She said if I buried it, she’d give me something better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Better like what?

utterance.speaker: DONNELLY
utterance.content: Better like murder.

utterance.speaker: DONNELLY
utterance.content: You see, Vivien said she was hot on a killer, said it was bigger than Steve Adams. This time, there was a body. She was going to let me film the moment she confronted the soon to be accused. She said that she had to confirm one last suspicion and that I had to be ready to go at a moment’s notice, because we were going to catch a killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when was this confrontation going to take place?

utterance.speaker: DONNELLY
utterance.content: Straight away. I got an urgent text about two hours later. I gathered up my crew, including security, thinking this was it. Then when I called her back, no answer. I’m guessing she was already dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any news on Vivien’s hunt for a murderer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, she had several clients who came to her because of unsolved crimes in the family, but the ones that we talked to said that their cases are just as cold now as when they first came to her.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, I found the cab. Driver says he took Vivien to a residence at 112th and Riverside. The doorman says he remembers Vivien going up to apartment 2C. It’s rented to Nick and Toni Johnston.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Toni Johnston?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: TJ.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So if Vivien came to see Toni Johnston the day she died, it had to have been about something important. Like this killer she was chasing. But you’ll probably say it as just a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, why is it so important to you that I believe all this stuff about fates and psychics and Santa Claus?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because... If you don’t believe in even the possibility of magic, you’ll never ever find it.

utterance.speaker: TONI JOHNSTON
utterance.content: Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Toni? I’m Detective Kate Beckett and this is Richard Castle –

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God…

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: I’m so stressed out. I can’t believe this is happening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you know that Vivien was murdered.

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: When I saw the paper yesterday, I nearly puked up my oatmeal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did Vivien come to visit you on Monday?

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: Look, this is all very personal and private. And it involves my sex life - will you promise to keep it confidential?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Absolutely.

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: Okay. Earlier this year, I did a terrible thing. I had an affair with my husband’s boss. Very discreet, no one ever knew about it. That’s why Vivien called me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She knew about the affair?

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: She called me out of the blue. She knew we met at the company Christmas party, that we used to … rendezvous … at the Starburst Hotel. Everything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Extraordinary.

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: I know, right? I mean, my mind was totally blown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: An affair? Ms. Johnston, did Vivien ever talk to you about murder?

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: No. She just told me she knew how I had cheated on Nick. My husband? And then she asked me a lot of questions about him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of questions?

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: She asked if he had a temper. And if I felt safe. She was sure Nick did know about the affair. Vivien said the spouse always knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she ever say how she knew all of this? All of this incredibly personal information, the details of which could not be readily found at the Hall of Records or through an internet search?

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: Oh yeah. The guy I was cheating with? He told her everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I’m going to have to speak with him.

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: Oh, you can’t. I mean, you can’t. He said. That’s why we stopped seeing each other. He died last April. Heart attack.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re telling me that your dead lover told Vivien about your affair.

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: That’s right. She said Emilio came to her in a dream.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emilio?

utterance.speaker: TONI
utterance.content: Emilio Casillas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your lover was Emilio Casillas?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Emilio Casillas’ autopsy file makes for some very interesting reading.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But do you think he was murdered?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: According to the ME’s notes, in addition to the cause of death – which was massive heart failure – Casillas showed signs of alopecia and his fingernails were thinning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means what, exactly?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’d have to exhume the body and run some tests, but it could be toxic overdose of selenium.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And, what’s selenium?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It’s a mineral that’s naturally found in the body and in small amounts is good for you. They even sometimes add it to diet pills, health drinks. But too much of it can be poisonous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Health drinks? Maybe it was also in the vitamins that the Casillases' made. So that would mean that it was at the factory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vivien told Toni that her husband knew about the affair with Emilio Casillas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Toni’s husband Nick works at the Casillases’ company. He would have easy access to the selenium and to Emilio.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And didn’t the Casillases’ daughter say that her father died in the office? That’s probably where he received the fatal dose.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Nick Johnston figures out his wife is sleeping with his boss and he poisons him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then Nick discovers that Vivien is on to him and kills her too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that would have been plenty of time for him to get to Vivien’s office, murder her, write the letter, all before the mail was picked up. But how did he find out that Vivien talked to Toni? Toni wouldn’t have told him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh, Toni didn’t. But Vivien did. The foreman said that Nick asked for the time off after he was visited by a woman. A woman who looked a lot like Vivien Marchand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Vivien was putting her plan into action. She’d bring Nick down to her office, call Cody Donnelly. She’d have him bring his camera crew. She would confront Nick about Emilio Casillas’ murder, capture it all on film.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vivien was about to solve Emilio’s murder and then be returned to her former glory as New York’s most famous psychic medium.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s a pretty bold move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But how did she get on to Emilio’s murder in the first place?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How many times do I have to say it? She was a psychic.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Psychic.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or. Maybe just very intuitive. According to Vivien’s notes, Paula said Emilio had been working longer hours in the months before his death. She wrote, ‘affair, question mark.’

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She also wrote this. Starburst Hotel. It’s the closest place to Emilio’s office that rents by the hour.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The manager there said Vivien came by last week. He confirmed, to Vivien, that the lovebirds had been regulars early this year. And she gave him two hundred bucks for his trouble.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. But how does Vivien go from ‘affair’ in general to ‘affair with Toni Johnston’? That, my friends, is a pretty big leap.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, uh, that is until you see the picture. This is from Vivien’s research. This is Toni, in the red dress, and Emilio next to her at the company’s last Christmas party. Pretty cozy, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But how … where did she get this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, there’s a bulletin board at the Casillases’ vitamin factory where employees post pictures. She could have taken it from there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Vivien suspects that Emilio is a cheater. She gets a hold of his autopsy file, starts thinking that maybe his cheating got him killed and she starts doing her usual research to prove her theory and all of this investigation leads her right back to Nick Johnston.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She had it all worked out. Right up until that awkward moment where Nick Johnston stabbed her in the neck with an ice pick and fed her to the couch.

utterance.speaker: NICK JOHNSTON
utterance.content: You’ve got the wrong guy. I didn’t kill that psychic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We know she came to see you.

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: She said she needed to talk to me in private. She said it was urgent, said it had something to do with my wife, so I punched out early and went uptown to her office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did you do when you got there?

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: Nothing. The door was locked. I pounded on it for ten minutes, nobody answered, I figured she was blowing me off. So I went home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s a pretty convenient story.

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: It’s the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, why don’t we start talking about Emilio Casillas?

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: What about him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You knew he was sleeping with your wife.

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: They thought they were being so careful, but yeah, I knew.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what did you do?

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Seriously, Nick? Do you actually expect me to believe that you just sat by and let your boss take your wife away from you? Do you think I’m that dumb?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s not that dumb.

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: Ah, I guess it doesn’t matter now. I… When I found out, I went to Emilio and I asked him to stop seeing her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what happened?

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: He said no. He was in love with her. I threatened to tell his wife, and he just said, do what you gotta do. So I decided that I wasn’t going to do his dirty work for him. If he wanted to leave his wife of thirty years then he should just be a man and do it himself. But I wanted to save my marriage, so I kept my mouth shut. Two weeks later, Emilio was dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you did nothing to help that along. Is that what you’re saying?

utterance.speaker: NICK
utterance.content: Help what along? He had a heart attack. The stress of being a lying, cheating asshat finally did him in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Penny Marchard is here? She says it’s urgent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Penny? What is it?

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Detective. I have something important to tell you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh Penny, is this about the mystery man? Because I really don’t know any Alexander.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexander?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll tell you about it later. Penny, I’m in the middle of a very important –

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: Detective, you have to listen to me. I know who murdered my mother.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So let me just … get this straight. You’re telling me that you had a dream, that your mother was murdered by the Freemasons.

utterance.speaker: PENNY
utterance.content: In the dream, I was having dinner with my mother in a Masonic hall. She was very concerned. She kept pointing to men around the room and saying ‘ask the Masons what happened. That’s the only way you’ll get closure.’

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Steve Adams’ alibi checked out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about Nick Johnston?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I told him not to take any trips out of town until we got this sorted out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the good news is, with this Freemasons lead we have a whole new crop of suspects.

utterance.speaker: RYAN_ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Freemasons?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ignore him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Paula and Marina Casillas. If they knew that Emilio was cheating, that would be motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe they found out that Vivien was investigating his death.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But they were Vivien’s clients. Why would murderers go to a psychic for closure?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They also have an alibi for the evening Vivien was killed. Uniforms canvassed the restaurant where they were dining with friends … they were there from five PM ‘til after seven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was this restaurant anywhere near Vivien’s office?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, around the corner. A new place. Mason’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ask the Masons and they will give you closure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s not get carried away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ask the Masons. Please? Just this once. Believe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You know what’s going on here?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, not really.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Me neither.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No matter what happens, we will never speak of this again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello, this is Detective Kate Beckett with the NYPD, could I speak with the owner, please? Hello, Mr. Mason? I have a couple of questions to ask you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mrs. Casillas, whose idea was it to go and visit Vivien Marchand in the first place?

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: We have had a very long day …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Please answer the question.

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: It was my idea. Mother thought it cost too much, but I missed daddy so much I was willing to try anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when she knew so many private things about your father?

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: It was almost like being with him. Like he was in the room with us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The night that Vivien Marchand was murdered the two of you went to dinner with friends at Mason’s.

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: That’s right. It’s a new place, my mother wanted to try it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The waiter confirmed that you were there from five until seven thirty. How was your meal? Did you order wine with dinner?

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: Yes. No, I mean, they don’t have a liquor license yet, so you bring your own.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you brought our own bottle of wine with you, then?

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: No. Mother went out to the liquor store and brought us a bottle. She was gone about twenty minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what time was that?

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: Five fifteen, maybe? What’s this all about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Paula, we went to the liquor store. You didn’t buy that bottle of wine at five fifteen. According to this receipt, you bought it at three twelve. And at the same time, you bought an ice pick.

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You bought that bottle of wine and then you put it aside and then at five fifteen you left the restaurant and went straight to Vivien’s office and you murdered her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then you went and you retrieved the bottle of wine, you returned to the restaurant, and you had dinner with your daughter and your friends.

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: That’s crazy! Mom, tell them!

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: Why would she do something like that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To cover up another murder. Your father’s.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you figure out that Emilio was cheating or did he tell you?

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: He told me. That he had met someone. That she was young and beautiful. And that I was just a boring old lady.

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: I took some selenium from the factory, and every morning I’d put a little bit in his coffee.

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Mom?

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: When you wanted to go see Vivien, I went along to humor you, but she knew things that she shouldn’t have known.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when she told you Emilio wanted to tell you something important…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And she said she was going to spend the evening communing with his spirit…

utterance.speaker: PAULA
utterance.content: That cheating son of a b*itch was going to tell on me. After everything he had done, I couldn’t let that happen. I had to kill her to stop him.

utterance.speaker: MARINA
utterance.content: Mother, stop talking! We want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, the Casillases lawyered up. He’s already trying to suppress her confession.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will that work?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I doubt it. But Paula’s done talking.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you ask her who wrote the letter?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I didn’t get a chance, so I guess it’ll have to remain a mystery.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, actually, not quite. Do you remember the last clue? The sound of knocking from far away? That would be Nick Johnston. He said he pounded on that door for quite some time before he finally gave up and went home. Vivien was already dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but Paula could have still been in the office waiting for him to leave. She would have heard the knocking just like she saw the phone, just like she saw Albert Moreno who was probably dressed in black, so she just put it into the letter to throw us off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm. Only according to your timeline on the murder board, by the time Nick got to the office at five forty five, Paula was back at the restaurant, so the office was empty. Except of course, for Vivien.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, before I forget? What did Penny say about Alexander?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, nothing. Just some silly stuff that didn’t really make any sense. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because my middle name is Alexander.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought your middle name was Edgar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Been perusing the personal section of the Richard Castle website again, have we? No, I changed my middle name to Edgar for Edgar Allen Poe back when I changed my last name to Castle. My given name is Richard Alexander Rodgers. What a coincidence, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I think that was a lovely service. And, if I may say, your speech was the best.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah, well, thank you for writing it. And I think, you know, between the two of us, we managed to capture the essence of Chet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: And Boomer and Lottie? Very, very gracious about taking the ring back and the whole …

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh God, I feel terrible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you really have nothing to feel guilty about.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh Richard, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No really. If anything, by telling Chet you wanted to think about getting engaged you gave him one more day of hope.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: But now he knows. He’s up there, I assume, and he knows everything. He knows he gave his heart to a woman who is shallow and a little cowardly and … didn’t really deserve him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Move over.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mere.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh honey, I …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nope, go on. Now you can ask Chet anything you want to know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Chet, darling, do you forgive me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There. Yes. Now you know.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh! You moved it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, I did. And let me tell you something else. Chet was nobody’s fool. He knew you. All of you. And he loved you. I’m sure that wherever he is now, he still does.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. Get some sleep.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard? Whatever mistakes I’ve made in my life, I raised a good man.
